subject: Re: [junit] a test pattern ?
msgSnippet: Thanks to everybody (Cedric, Elliotte, James, Adam, Paul and J.B.) for helping me out.  I ve learned alot from this thread.  And - I ve ordered JUnit Recipes
messageBody:
Thanks to everybody (Cedric, Elliotte, James, Adam, Paul and J.B.) for
helping me out. I've learned alot from this thread. And - I've
ordered JUnit Recipes from Amazon.

Having just started with JUnit and with the idea of writing tests for
all of my code, I must say that I'm delighted with the results. Oh -
I'm not writing much new code. Most of the unit tests are for code
that already exists for which I'm fixing bugs.

There isn't much support for tests on my team because we tend to be in
fire-fighting mode all the time. So, of course, we'll right good tests
"later". However, the tests have helped me much more than I would
have expected with:

* developing a faster, deeper understanding of the code I'm working with

* improving the design of existing code (so that I can actually test something!)

* giving me the confidence to make changes and knowing that I'm not
breaking related code

* thinking more deeply about what I'm doing

I really can't imagine going back to not writing tests. Now the thing
I need to do next is figure out how to build support for running a
suite of tests as part of our build process and getting our other
developers to create and run tests, too.

Thank you all again -

Chris
